section.p: The ListApplications task is used to list applications that are installed on a WebSphere server.

Running the ListApplications task from the commandline is done using the following syntax (optional parameters omitted):
mvn was5:ListApplications -DwasHome=<path to WAS>
section.h2: Running ListApplications with definition in pom
section.p:
Running the StartServer task with the definition defined in the build section of the pom (optional parameters omitted):
<dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>was5-plugin</artifactId> <version>1.0</version> <scope>runtime</scope> </dependency> </dependencies>
<build> <plugins> <plugin> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>was5-plugin</artifactId> <version>1.0</version> <executions> <execution> <id>start was</id> <phase>pre-integration-test</phase> <goals> <goal>ListApplications</goal> </goals> <configuration> <wasHome> C:/Programfiles/WebSphere/AppServer </wasHome> </configuration> </execution> </executions> </plugin> </plugins> </build>
